Project Allocation and Statistics

Historical data on project quotas, level distributions, and program statistics

📊 Innovation Program Allocation and Statistics

This section provides comprehensive historical data on the allocation of Innovation Program projects across different levels over the years, along with key statistics on program implementation. All information is based on official notices from the Academic Affairs Office of Dongguan University of Technology.

📈 Historical Allocation Trends (2013-2025)

The following table shows the comprehensive project allocation trends over the past thirteen years:

YearUniversity LevelProvincial LevelNational LevelSpecial Support ProjectsTotalGrowth Rate
20251909545-3300%
20241909545-330-4.90%
20231909545-330-5.71%
20221909545-330-8.33%
20212409030-3606.82%
20202248627-337-15.75%
201926010040-4002.56%
20182609040-3908.33%
20172408040-3600.00%
2016----360414.29%
2015----7032.08%
2014----531.92%
2013----52-

Note:

  1. 📋 Data for some years (2013-2014, 2016-2019) is incomplete in the official archives. The numbers presented are reconstructed based on available references in subsequent documents and may contain minor discrepancies.
  2. 📊 From 2022 to 2025, the project allocation has stabilized, indicating the program has entered a mature phase.
  3. ⚠️ The abnormal growth rate between 2015 and 2016 (414.29%) may be due to program redefinition and changes in statistical criteria.
  4. 📉 Negative growth in some years reflects the university's adjustments to improve overall project quality rather than quantity.

Note:

  1. ✅ Completion Rate = (Excellent + Good + Qualified) / Total Projects × 100%
  2. 🥇 Excellence Rate = Excellent Projects / Total Projects × 100%
  3. ❌ Failed categories include: Failed/Unqualified, Not Defended, Terminated, and No Final Report
  4. ℹ️ "Good" rating was removed in 2020-2022 due to evaluation system adjustments
  5. 📊 Statistical criteria vary between years, comparisons should consider these differences
  6. ⏳ 2024 data will be available after projects complete their final evaluations

📢 Project Publicity Process

The project publicity phase ensures transparency in the project selection process. After review completion, the university publicizes preliminarily approved projects through multiple channels.

🎯 Publicity Purpose

Project publicity serves several key functions:

  1. 🔍 Transparency: Ensures open and fair project selection
  2. ⚖️ Accountability: Makes evaluation results publicly accountable
  3. 🏆 Recognition: Acknowledges successful student teams and faculty advisors
  4. 📰 Information Sharing: Provides visibility into the innovation landscape
  5. 🤝 Conflict Resolution: Allows for objections or corrections before finalization

⏱️ Publicity Timeline

A typical publicity process follows this schedule:

StageTimingDuration
Initial Review2-3 weeks after application deadline-
Preliminary ResultsFollowing initial review-
Publicity PeriodAfter preliminary results5-7 working days
Objection HandlingDuring publicity periodCase-dependent
Final ConfirmationAfter publicity period-
Official NotificationWithin 1 week after confirmation-

📋 Publicity Content

Project publicity typically includes:

  • 📑 Project Details: ID, title, category, level, and special support status
  • 👥 Team Information: Project leader, team members, and faculty advisors
  • 📝 Project Overview: Brief description, keywords, and expected outcomes

📣 Distribution Channels

Information is distributed through:

  1. 📋 Official Bulletin Boards: Physical notices in the Academic Affairs building
  2. 🌐 University Website: Electronic announcements on the Academic Affairs Office website
  3. 🏫 College Websites: Announcements on individual college websites
  4. 💻 Innovation Platform: Dedicated project management system
  5. 📧 Email Notifications: Direct communication with stakeholders

💰 Funding Information

💵 Funding Standards

The funding allocation standards for different project levels:

YearUniversity LevelProvincial LevelNational LevelSpecial Support Projects
2025¥5,000¥10,000-20,000¥10,000-20,0002× regular funding
2024¥4,000¥8,000-16,000¥8,000-16,0002× regular funding
2022-2023¥5,000¥10,000-20,000¥10,000-20,0002× regular funding
2013-2021¥5,000¥10,000¥20,000-

Note:

  1. 💼 2024 funding is at 80% of standard levels, with the difference to be reimbursed in 2025
  2. 🔍 Special support projects were established in 2022, receiving twice the regular funding

📊 Funding Utilization

No comprehensive data available yet.

Note: 💰 Funding utilization rate refers to the percentage of allocated funds actually used by projects.

🔄 Program Implementation Process

The Innovation Program at Dongguan University of Technology comprises four key phases each year:

  1. 📢 Project Notification - Announcement of quotas, funding details, and application requirements
  2. 📋 Project Publicity - Publication of approved projects, teams, and advisors
  3. 🔍 Mid-term Assessment - Evaluation of progress and continued funding eligibility
  4. 🏁 Final Acceptance - Final evaluation of project outcomes and completion status

For detailed information on each component, please visit:

  • Application Process
  • Mid-term Requirements
  • Final Acceptance Standards
